newsitem.title: DENMARK: FORECAST-Jyske Bank 97 Q1 profit to fall.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Jyske Bank 97 Q1 profit to fall.

text.p: Four bank analysts polled by Reuters in a survey published on Friday said Jyske Bank, Denmark's fourth biggest bank, would have a slightly lower first quarter 1997 result compared to the same 1996 period.

The panel forecast an average 220 million crown profit before tax and extraordinary items for the year's first three months compared to 225 million crowns in the same period last year, a 2.2 percent fall.
The estimates ranged from 183 to 302 million crowns.
Jyske is the only Danish bank to issue quarterly results. Its first quarter 1997 results are due on April 22.

On February 20, Jyske Bank announced a better than expected full year 1996 profit before tax and extraordinary items of 993 million crowns, well up on 1995's 961 million crowns and forecast an even better result this year.
